Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean and suitable.”
Reviews.Author: VivianVivacqua
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in May 2011. For it's purpose - getting to know Memphis, walking around all day and returning to the hotel for a shower and to sleep it's a great place. Simple, clean and cozy. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: brandi t
Reviews.Content: We stayed here so that we could park for the week to go on our honeymoon. It was cheaper and I believe safer for it to stay at the hotel than at the airport parking lot. It was in a very easy place to get too, close to the airport, and they shuttled us at 4 in the morning with a smile! Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel facilities, poor staff training”
Reviews.Author: sprintxoxo
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 3 nights at Regency Inn and Suites, at Memphis Airport during the new year weekend. While the hotel facilities (bed, cleanliness, good sound proofing, complimentary parking, microwave) are good, we had some discomfort as hotel guests. The room was not made after the first night with neither any explanation, nor apology. I had to call Housekeeping, twice, to get fresh towels. On the day we checked out, the phone rang at 8:30 AM - we did not ask for morning call. When we ignored this, there was a knock on the door a minute later from a female housekeeping staff. There was another knock on the door at 9:40 AM from another male housekeeping staff. The check-out time is noon. It just shows how poor this hotel is run, as there is no coordination among departments. Also, if you stay here, please double check your payment receipt before you leave to make sure that all charges are correct.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it. Regency Inn and Suites exceeded our expectation”
Reviews.Author: ashdod105
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for one night for the family to meet at a convenient location. The staff at the front office was professional and friendly. The staff made sure that we were comfortable. We were impressed with the courteous can-do attitude among the staff. Job well done to all, especially the manager on duty!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EJT_21
Reviews.Content: This is the absolute worst hotel I have ever visited in my life. My flight was canceled and I needed a close hotel to the airport to catch my rescheduled early morning flight. Upon entering the room I was appalled at the dirty and unsanitary conditions. I immediately asked for another room when I saw roaches crawling up the wall. Not to my surprise the second room was not any better. There were dead cockroaches on the floor and I immediately asked for a refund and left the hotel. I would never even look in this hotel's direction or recommend this disgusting establishment to anyone. This hotel needs to be condemned and the owner should be ashamed of him/herself for running such a horrible establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: meme828
Reviews.Content: My mother and I booked a room with 2 double beds at the beginning of May for our stay at the beginning of July. We were a bit dubious after seeing the rate of $40 per night, but we had positive experiences staying there when it was still the Radisson so we decided to give it a shot. When we arrived, the front desk clerk informed us that they didn't have a room with 2 double beds available and they could only offer us a room with a queen or a king. Irritated, we pulled out the confirmation we had printed when we booked it that said we had a confirmed reservation. The sassy clerk (who didn't even have a name tag on so we could report her to the manager) told us that she couldn't do anything except stand there and keep telling us that she couldn't give us the room we wanted. She didn't even seem remotely interested in trying to find an alternate solution for us and told us to call the manager, who conveniently wasn't there. Needless to say we will never be staying here again, regardless of how convenient it is. This hotel has gone downhill since it became Regency Inn and Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Laughable”
Reviews.Author: Bucky682
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in some pretty questionable hotels before, but this one might take the cake. My brother and I stayed at this hotel mainly due to the location. The hotel was difficult to find due to the Airport being under construction. We circled the terminal a good 2-3 times before finally getting into the parking lot of the hotel. You could see the hotel, just couldn't get in. The check in process took a long time (30 minutes +) considering I had the confimation numbers. They couldn't find my reservation, even though I had made it online (through Regency) days before. When we got to the room I immediately noticed that the door to the room had been kicked in at one point. The deadbolt wouldn't lock and the swing lock was completely missing. The peephole had also been filled with kleenex since that was also missing. There were sleep number beds in the room, both of which were broken. The bathroom door had also been kicked in and wouldn't latch closed. There was mold on the walls and in the hallways around the elevator. We also had no hot water for showers in the morning. Most disturbing was the presence of what appeared to be prostitutes in the lobby (12:30am). I'm 9 months pregnant, had I not been staying here with my brother I would have left and found a different hotel. Something else worth mentioning. The Memphis airport is the main hub for FedEx flights, which leave between 10pm and 5am. If you're staying here bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: sabernath
Reviews.Content: I had to drop off my car and take a flight with my kinds. Hotel had facility to drop off cars and had shuttle to the airport, which was very convenient. Tip; request for room away from run way if available sice the hotel is close to the airport. the hotel was clean and also had resturant and lounge which was a plus. The desk clerks were very friendly and the resturant staff was exceptional. I even got a shuttle ride at the time i requested.

Reviews.Title: “Hazard Warning: Do Not Book This Place”
Reviews.Author: Irchel
Reviews.Content: We were among a dozen of other tourists, holding a confirmation (all booked thru different third parties) for April 30 - May 1, 2011 (during the Memphis Festival). At the check-in counter the hotel informed us as well as the a.m. other guests that they were overbooked and therefore could not give us rooms. Apparently, the hotel had not received the third party reservations for that date. We could understand it if it were one single provider as transmission problems can occur, but all parties booked thru different providers like Orbitz, hotels. com, priceline etc. Our conclusion is that the hotel gave away the rooms to walk-ins at the double rate due to the Festival and rejected all 'low-revenue bookings'. In addition, hotel staff was extremely arrogant. We arrived in the evening, exhausted and looking forward to a good night sleep, traveling with a toddler and a senior citizen. We were left on our own; the hotel provided no support in finding an alternative. All hotels were fully booked that weekend and we had to drive one hour to Jackson, where we were lucky to get the 2 last rooms in a room, arriving at 2 a.m.. It's good we had a car. There were other 'stranded' tourists without a car who spent US$ 30 for a cab just to get to the airport hotel as there was allegedly no shuttle bus to this 'airport' hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management and service”
Reviews.Author: HPSHETYE
Reviews.Content: The front desk is so slow that it took over 2 hrs of wait in the line after a Delta flt was delayed. She was acting as if they were doing a favor providing us the rooms. Not recommended at all. Poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: meterboy44
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience, no one knew what was going on. They over booked the hotel by ton's and had to turn alot of people away. The front desk staff wasnt helpful at all.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: TCTRAVEL54
Reviews.Content: Confirmed reservation & Airport pick up before leaving home from California. Told to call and hotel 24hr shuttle would pick us up from Airport. Called upon arrival at midnight, but no telephones at Hotel were ever answered upon calling. Paid for Taxi to hotel and upon arrival were told the Hotel was very oversold , they could not accommodate us with our Confirmed Reservation, and acted like they did not care. Being 2 woman alone, after midnight in an unknown area, we located a last minute different hotel on our own, but very uncomfortable doing so.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!!”
Reviews.Author: Seelos1
Reviews.Content: I was assigned to this hotel by Delta Airlines because they cancelled my flight. It was late, I was tired and the rest is a nightmare. The person behind the desk was nice, but distracted by other employees. Never looked up at me when I asked about the restaurant, which is a whole other story -ouch! The room I assigned to was I am sure on the runway. FedEx was flying at 3 am and that was my last sleep. The hallways and my room smelled like Jet fuel. Breakfast was unappetizing. It was a buffet with undercooked bacon and over cooked green eggs. I couldn't wait to get out of there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hell”
Reviews.Author: Lusp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to a runway that is used all night by FedEx heavy freighters. The building shakes as the planes take off all night long. The hotel is worn and drab. The employees are bored and disinterested. The restaurant offerings are limited and poor quality. This is the worst experience I have had in over 40 years of traveling. This is where Delta lodges traveler whose travel has been disrupted.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, convenience, staff.”
Reviews.Author: Mt453
Reviews.Content: This is the most convenient place to stay when flying, fast shuttle service from the airport, super friendly staff, had a small problem with a credit card charge but they fixed it without delay. Not extra fancy, but very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like jet engines roaring 100 feet from your bed.”
Reviews.Author: cab049
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at this hotel a couple days ago. I didn't use any of the services really, so I can't tell you about them. The only things I used where the TV, and ate breakfast there. The breakfast was fine, but the TV stations didn't come in very well, most of them were fuzzy. Really I don't care much about that, the thing that sucked were all the planes. I understand that it is an airport hotel, but it is located next to the runway. What this means is that about 10:30 PM all the planes start landing for FedEx, this goes on for about an hour or an hour and a half, constantly. Then it stops. At about three in the morning the planes start taking off. This lasted until I had to get up at 4:20 AM. It starts by kind of sounding like someone is using a vacuum in the room next to you, and then ends with a big roar, and your bed shaking. There would be a new plane at least every five minutes to make sure that you don't get any sleep. If your plan is to get some sleep while at the hotel, this is not the one for you. The rest of the hotel seemed fine, but when I go to a hotel, I want to be able to sleep, if I can't do that, it has failed me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you're using MEM, average hotel, too expensive for what they offer”
Reviews.Author: Habby31
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviews here are very unreasonable and suspicious to me. I stayed here for one night early in 2010 and the place was fine, bug free and as clean as any of 1000 other hotels. Bar & restaurant were nothing to write home about but both were decent enough. Staff was very helpful. Shuttle to airport is excellent and very quick. What I didn't like; $89.00 a night was a little pricey for a very average hotel, 50 bucks would be much more in line IMHO. My room was literally FEET from an active runway. I could look out the window and actually see the flight crews on FedEx aircraft as they taxied past and turned to take off what seemed like less than 1000 feet from my room! Thankfully that night, they switched runways at about 10 PM. Bottom line, average hotel that is a little pricier than it should be. Look at the reviews suggesting it's bug infested...most look to be written by people who have no other reviews to contribute...sound suspicious to you? Like maybe they have a vendetta??? I saw now bugs and found the hotel very clean on my visit.

Reviews.Title: “iT REALLY WAS NOT TOO BAD”
Reviews.Author: travelingduo_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed through Priceline so the price was great. We were surprised how nice the hotel was after reading all the very bad reviews. We asked for a room in the front of the Hotel. You can hardly hear the airplanes at all there but had to move rooms and ended up in the back BAD NEWS FOLKS!!! The planes are right outside your window and wake you up all night. We had no mold no roaches as stated in other reviews. Our sleep number bed was great!.I would recommend this nice hotel IF YOU WERE IN THE FRONT.

Reviews.Title: “Super bar staff and great fellow travellers”
Reviews.Author: Patsy201
Reviews.Content: We had a few problems at first but the staff and manager went above board to make our stay the best. New owners and they are determined to make it the best place to stay. The shuttle driver was so helpful and friendly also. Rooms were fine. We requested extra cream and sugar for our morning coffee and they delivered it promptly.

HotelInfo.Name: Regency Inn and Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 2411 Winchester Road, Memphis, TN 38116
